text:
[8877-20161111] Bottle. Light straw grains yeast aroma. Hazy, pale orange yellow body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Yeasty straw grains flavour. Medium body. Tasty, easy to drink. (7/4/8/4/16) 3.9
(c/o mds, w/ him, jercraigs)
Banana, banana, banana, something about my bug eyes, my gaping jaw....lots o banana in this one. Never watched Game of Thones but they inspired a delicious beer. Would get again.

750ml bottle: this one pours a cloudy golden color. There was a small white head that doesnt linger long. Interesting nose. Herbal, floral, banana, spice. The taste is good. Some spice, banana, wheat, lemon. Slightly effervescent on the tongue. Tasty!

Bouteille 750 ml. Couleur or, mousse blanche. Arôme épicée, levure, fruits jaunes et houblon. En bouche, bonne base maltée, moyennement soyeuse, phénols, beaucoup de houblon, une amertume assez présente, houblon en finale et assez sèche. Bonne combinaison.
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 From bottle into wine glass. Cloudy yellow color, large white head. Nose is lemon, yeast, stone fruit, nice hoppy nose. Medium sweet mouth, high carbonation. Nice beer.

Bottle: Poured a slightly hazy golden color ale with a nice large white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of light dry hoppy notes with some citrus undertones and some light sweet wheat malt notes. Taste is a good mix of sweet wheat malt notes with some citrus undertones and some dry hoppy notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not earth shattering but pleasant enough.
Hazy golden yellow pour with a creamy white head Aroma of banana, spice, and bread. Excellent lacing with citrus fruit flavor with bread, slight touch of must, and banana. Very nice.
Light golden pour with a lot of sediment. Got a lot of flavour, a bit of a banana note. Very strong wheaty flavour, fresh bread aroma. Hits the mark for a strong yeasty belgian wheat.

Shared 750 ml bottle (thanks LJ). 
Pours slightly hazy and golden with a fine white head. 
Fruity-funky-yeasty aroma with a flavor to match although much less funky. Moderately bitter with some wheat bread. 
Medium body and medium+ carbonation.

Bottle from the LCBO. Cloudy pale orange-amber under a fluffy long lasting white head that leaves some sparse lace. Nose is wheat, yeast, banana, apricot, citrus, honey, some grass and a light spice. Light sweet honey and caramel under a moderate floral bitterness with lemon and lime secondary. Citrus is quite subdued in the taste which is a bit odd given the hop profile, but it REALLY works. Mouth is medium with active carbonation and a dry lightly spicy finish. 

8/4/9/4/16+

De couleur jaune pale avec beaucoup de lie dans le verre. Leffervescence bien présente fait virevolté. Une tête soutenue crémeuse et épaisse. De par ses saveurs floraux, de blé, dépices rehaussé par un léger goût de citron qui restera presque jusquà cette finale douche et sèche. Très bien!

[Bottle (750ml)] Pours a cloudy yellow-gold with an average size lasting frothy white head. Some lacing. Nice aroma, hoppy and a bit spicy along with Belgian yeast, wheat and some fruit. Flavour of Belgian yeast and hops, nicely balanced between the two, along with some light spiciness (maybe from the hops?) and light herbs. Medium bodied. I loved this.

Tornado of carbonation through the glass with a white frothy cap that stays forever. Eventually some thick lacing. Light yellow colour with lots of yeast particles floating around. Aromas of citrus, grass, wheat, spices and honey. The taste is floral with the grassy hops giving nice bitterness. Hard to taste the wheat, but balances things. Another good one.

Corked bottle, I am a sucker for this series. Hazy yellow gold, large white head with good retention. Aroma is wheaty, faint Belgian yeast spiciness, and a lemon lime hoppy note. Flavor matches, and is a very nice meld of wheat, yeast, and hops. Comes off a bit saison-like for a lack of a better way of describing it. Very surprised at how they got lemon and lime notes out of these hops and not as much as the typical "American" hop notes you typically get. Nice stuff.

Bottle. Poured hazy amber color with an average to large frothy white head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy wheat, citrus and yeast aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy spice sweet flavor with a medium spice sweet finish of moderate to long duration. I would recommend this to a friend.

Un liquide doré léger, avec une bonne carbonatation et un nez envoûtant de fruits jaunes et de blé frais. La bouche est enivrante, des saveurs tranchantes dagrumes et dananas, un alcool retenu mais bien présent, et des houblons piquants et aromatiques, mais pas trop amérisants. Une bière de blé avec beaucoup de mordant, quasi irréprochable, très satisfaisante

750 ml bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a hazy golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have pale wheat malts, floral and herbal hops, moderate bitterness especially for the style, citrus character, yeast, mild spicy character, lingering floral soapy character.

Bottle; pours cloudy gold with a white head; aroma of citrus fruits and wheat with some yeast and floral notes; taste is light bitter with wheat, citrus fruits, yeast, and a some floral hints; finish is bitter with some citrus hints
Thick white head, nice lacing, cloudy straw color. Spice aroma w/hints of grass. Hoppy finish that lingers.

750 ml bottle from LCBO, served quite cool in a tulip glass. 
App.: Cloudy bright yellow with a tight and fluffy white head.
 
Aroma: Quite spicy and citrusy, resinous hops, peppery, light fruity esters, a little yeast/wet bread dough, a little floral honey, biscuit and kind of a bread crust thing.
 
Palate: Medium body with full and somewhat aggressive carbonation.
 
Flav.: Spicy with nice fruity esters, citrus peel, a little earthy, wet bread dough and yeast, biscuit maltiness, quite good; off-dry with fairly firm bitterness and a long, estery/fruity and somewhat spicy finish.

Nice beer.

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with large, lacey white head. Aroma is spicy and fruity Belgian yeast with citrus and floral hoppiness. Flavour has lots of bright tree fruit with apple and lemon most prominent, wheat, clove and citric and floral hops. Lively, fine carbonation. Nice.

Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head that laces the glass. Aroma is citrus fruits and wheat. It has a wheat, citrus and banana flavour with a mild bitter. Wasnt sure about a beer based off a tv show, but I was pleasantly suprised.
Bottle from LCBO. Spicy and slightly fruity aroma. Piney taste, resin, citrus, spice, moderate bitter finish. Good.
Birthday bomber thanks to my lovely wife. Nose is lemon zest, wheat and white pepper. Sip adds grapefruit. Somewhat balanced but bitterness wins out. Honey/herbal finish.

Pours hazy straw gold with a big frothy pillow on top and some floaties. Aroma is faint wheat, banana and light citrus hops. Taste is light wheat chewiness with banana and clove. Well balanced with light citrus hop acidity. A little soapy in the end.

2016-11-11. Hazy dark pastel yellow body, nice head. 4+ Aroma is pleasant, light lemon and grassy touches. Flavour is similar, light lemon, wheaty grass touches, moderate bitterness throughout. Average plus bodied palate, good effervescent carbonation. Tasty 7/4/7/3/16+ Bottle from the LCBO shared by mds.
Thick white head over a cloudy, high carbonation beer with a lot of floaties. Nice beer.

Bottle from LCBO. Clear golden yellow with fluffy white head. Hoppy aroma with some straw and a hint of banana. Smooth wheaty taste with a lingering hop bitterness. Pretty good, but I?m not overly partial to this style.

750ml cork and cage bottle from LCBO. Pours a huge foamy bubbly white head and has a hazy golden appearance with sediments clearly visible. Leaves some dirty lacing behind. Aromas are wheaty, some notes of yeast, citrus and floral hops, quite nice. Flavours are mostly wheaty, yeasty and citrusy. Also some hints of bananas, spices and oats. Some nice hoppy notes and little bitterness but nothing too overwhelming, very well balanced. Lively carbonation. Has a nice smooth and creamy mouthfeel, very silky. Good stuff!

750ml bottle from LCBO. 6.9% alc./vol. Pours an opaque gold colour with one finger of white head. Aromas of grapefruit, banana, citrus and some floral notes. Taste matches the aroma with some peppery notes and ends with IPA-like dry and hoppy finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Hazy yellow pour, big white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, big lemon, citrus notes, lots of wheat, and lemon zest. Nice mouth feel, lively carb. Finish is again big on what a with a strong lemon flavour. Huge lemon zest, and lemon rind with a strong citrus pith bitterness. Nice stuff.

Draft pour. The beer is a hazed yellow with a white head of foam. Good retention. Aroma is herbal and perfumy. Lots of perfumy notes. Medium body and medium moderately carbonated. Mildly bitter and has nice esters. Pretty good.

Smell of hop, lemon, fragrance. Come in light yellow with thin white crown. Taste smooth, happy hop, slightly sour with lemon & citrus, somewhat bitter but good balanced. Somewhat slimy texture. Well rounded beer.
nice color subtle taste. love the bouquet and the finish.  a nice light taste  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bomber. Thanks to KL. Fruity nose, with light Belgian yeastiness, some wheat, Pale blonde color. Light wheatiness, mild but persistent bitterness. Sweet fruit emerges in mid palate. Balances more or less in finish. Medium body. Pleasant. Maybe a touch too sweet, but good.
Bottle from Hegedorns. Nice noble-like hop nose, lemon, herbs, wheat. Lemony, crisp flavor, wheat comes through nicely and creamy. A bit too sweet, but otherwise well done.
Sugary wheat taste with lots of bright hops, but it is wheat forward. Good drinkability, though a bomber is forcing too much on us.

Keg at Sedona Charlottesville, 4/4/16. Hazy golden, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of pale malt, wheat, floral hops and lime. The taste is wheat, spice, lemon peel, lime. Medium bodied, well balanced, pleasant.

Extremely active carbonation in this golden brew capped with white foamy peaks. Aroma is full of juicy citrus, tropical notes, spice, yeast, and light soap. Medium bodied. The spice is much more evident in the flavor than aroma. Tropical fruits, citrus, candied notes, and light boozy heat. Finish is spicy and medium bitterness. Lightly dry. A very "fresh" tasting brew with a good mix of fruit and spice. Easily the best hoppy wheat ale Ive had and on of the only ones done properly, IMO.

750ml bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a huge, thick, frothy, long lasting, white head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet, fruity aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, banana, wheat malt, yeast and coriander. Sweet, fruity flavour of lemon, orange, tropical fruit, wheat malt, and yeast with coriander in a dry finish. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Well balanced and easy drinking. Very nice.
clear, gold color; spicy Belgian yeast and citrusy hop aroma; nice, mild Belgian yeast and spice notes with floral, citrusy hop notes on a light, wheat malt base; well balanced

Clear light straw yellow pour to start. Second pour brought the sediments. Aroma initially was mild yeasty banana. Second pour strengthened atoma. Taste follows nose. Once the sediment was poured, the yeast came forward. Nice beer.

750ml bottle 7/28/16 (Binnys-Naperville)-42° in Trappist Glass-Pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, yeast, banana, coriander, and spices. Taste of the same with a bit more hops on the back end along with some dryness. This light bodied brew is well balanced and easy drinking. Nice brew.

It pours light golden with a white creamy head. It has good head retention and has a slight haze to it. There is also plenty of lacing. It has aromas of yeast, citrus, grain, and moderately-low banana. There are flavors high in spice, moderate levels of fruit, some clove, banana, and citrus. The grain flavors have a bit of sweet to it. It has a dry finish with moderate carbonation. It has a very slight warming to it. There is also a bit of a bite on the palate. Overall, this is a complex combination of yeast, hops, and malts that produces quite a bit of flavor and aroma.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Aroma of slightly bitter malt and wheat. Hazy light golden amber color, pasty smooth 1" white head that stays for the duration, splotches of lace. Taste is wheat and malt with strong carbonation, followed by distinctive hops that stay the whole way, even though light spice emerges, and wheat returns for a curtain call. Overall, good, but Ive had better. Not likely to repeat.

Rated on 7-16-2016 at 800 Degrees Three Fires, Fort Wayne, IN. The appearance of this draft beer when served is a very small off-white head that is fully lasting, pale yellow transparent body, no visible carbonation, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is citrus hops, wheat, floral, fruity, banana, spicy, and malty. The flavor presents moderate bitteress, citrus hops, wheat, fruity, spicy, some banana, and malt. The mouthfeel is moderate carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. A drinkable beer for the style, but definitely not my favorite beer for this style.
Thanks to Gil. This was pretty good. The best part was that they didnt hop the crap out of it even through it said hoppy wheat ale. But it still had nice hop presences. Serving: Bottle

This draft brew from a restaurant poured a head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a very softly carbonated transparent weak yellow colored body and a good lacing. The weak aroma was musty. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a lingering mild vinous hop aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of wheat vinous and hops. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

750ml corked and caged bottle into a hefe glass, cold.

Aroma: spice! Banana! Fruit! Juicy! A teeny bit of grass! Just bursting!

Appearance: Moderately hazy pale gold body, thick thick thick white head that takes a loooong time to go away. HEAVY lacing. High effervescence.

Taste: Hoppy! A little spice at the end but this is a hop driven beer. Lingers.

Palate. Clean and light. A little bit of stick on the back of the tongue.

Overall: A great experience! Challenging and unexpected.
Slight Belgium yeasty scent and flavor. Nice citric bite and hoppy aftertaste to it. Lighter yellow and cloudy. Tap

Bottle. Pours clear, light yellow, with a big foamy, fully lasting, white head that leaves great lacing. Aroma of cloves and grass. Medium body, too much carbonation, lightly sour, flavors of cloves and lemon, lightly bitter and a long lightly bitter and dry finish.

Appearance- Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thick fluffy head, almost a whipped cream consistency. 
Aroma- Spicy, grassy, yeasty, bready.
Flavor- Coriander, citrus, pepper, wheat,

750 mL bottle. Pours a clear gold color with a thick white head that slowly settles to a film leaving some lacing. Aroma has a nice floral aroma along with just a touch of sourness. Medium bodied, great combination of wheat and hops. Finish is slightly bitter and dry with some of the hops lingering after the swallow. Excellent!

Pours gold with a large head.
Nose shows floral hops, lychee, passionfruit and doughy wheat.
Flavours include pine and herbal hops as well as soft grassy notes. Some wheat too.

Minimal nose with light grain....pour is a very clear yellow that looks similar to apple juice....taste is light with some grains malt and a tad of lemon...not great but ok...as it warms more lemon and belgian funk come out...(#859)

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Clearish, light gold with a lovely white meringue head, resilient, spotty lace, yeasties at the bottom of the poor . Belgian spice/yeast aroma, lemongrass, biscuit, some coriander. A maltier backbone than I expected on the tongue....white grape, fresh spice, sun drenched grass, wheaty notes before some lemon zest in the finish...Good stuff.

750 bottle to cervoise. Pours hazy straw, effervescent with big white sticky froth head. Aroma of biscuit, banana, orange, soured grapes, apple, Belgian spice yeast. Taste of banana, bitter oak, toasted burned biscuits, lemon, grass, white pepper. Smells a lot better than taste. Super acidic lemon. Light body.

Near clear yellow piss pour with ample white head. Smells better than it tastes. the hoppiness is definitely more in the bitterness spectrum than the flavor profile. Its like a blue moon minus the orange and amp up the bitterness.
On tap, golden yellow color with tall foam, aroma is fruity wax, flavor of some fruit, honey and synthetic , finish is plastic
Pouring at TAP NY 2106. Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Soft musk and citrus, big yeast. Medium bodied, fruity with big yeast and esters. Light musk. Slow musk, soft bitterness.
Pours a pale golden orange color with a thick white head. Fruit, citrus, floral, funk, yeast and wheat aroma and flavors. Medium body and lively carbonation. Fruit, yeast and wheat finish. Nice.

750 ml. Ive never seen the show nor read the books, but I like the brewery. Hazy wheat beer body, bushy head. The taste is a nice blend of hops and yeast, mostly in the grapefruit and lemon range. Slightly bitter. Feels lighter than the ABV. Good.

Bottle at trailer. Clear golden color with lasting white head. Nice spicy, herbal, light toast, dry hay aromas. 
Spicy, dusty, herbal, citrus hoppy flavors with pale wheat bread----good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
I had this at Global Brew. Pours straw yellow with a white head. Taste spices, citrus, wheat. I thought this was good. I would drink this again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I gave up on the TV series when the fantasy exceeded my visions after a night of craft beers! But I love this beer! Cloudy full body. Tangy hops. Suggest that they dump the HBO royalties and offer this in six packs year around!

750, corked and caged. Nose of wheat slime, traditional garpefruit-orange PNW hops. Pour cloudy yellow with a large and jiggling white head. Taste is spicy with surprising (but clean) medium bitterness, really jacks up the Belgian yeast coefficient, heavy banana and pear esters, significantly lower clove, medium black pepper, a little bit slipper/soapy but not laden with resin. Full body, round with faint tartness, crisp but not aggressive, a little booze showing, dash of jammy fruit before chalky-lemony finish. Coriander? Theres some sweetness from the hops but slight drying by the end. Dont know what I expected, its somewhere between a strong wit and a tripel, suffering much from "imperialization." But as an alcohol transference mechanism, sure does its job. [2016.06.19: 3.2]

Prepping for the battle of the bastards episode with this. Smell is sweet and earthy. Pours a golden straw yellow color with a foamy sticky white head. Medium body, slightly syrupy/slick feel. Taste well balanced. Hops notes are theres tgepoughout but to dont get harsh or dominate at all and allows the wheat characteristics to stay out front. Solid over all.
C-. Pours a cloudy yellow color with white head. Tastes okay except the lingering bitterness

(Bottle) Hazy, pale gold body with a large, frothy white head. Aroma is very floral with lots of yeast; saw dust; peach, mango, and banana. Medium- to full-bodied; syrupy-sticky mouthfeel. Dry, yeasty hop flavor with mango, ripe banana, spice. A little hoppier than a traditional Belgian, but very good with a lot of interesting things going on.

Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a thick white head. Aroma was yeasty and fruity with citrus, wheat, and banana esters. Flavor of yeast, wheat, banana, citrus, pepper, coriander and spice. nice overall

Golden color with a towering head. Aroma of dusty wheat and grain, with light tropical fruit. Moderately strong bitterness. Light fruity character, a bit of orange. Possibly soapy. Very light bubblegum.

Really enjoyed this. There's a subtle sweetness that is rounded out by hoppy bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy hay yellow with a large white head. Aroma is wheat with a bit of citrus hops. Flavor is light and crisp, wheat up front with a hop snap in the finish.

Heavy clove nose. Clear gold with fluffy head and spotty lacing. Delicate yet rich taste. Small carbonation. Pepper in taste with soft fruitiness. A bit of a mineral hard bitter finish. Syrupy mouthfeel. Really is quite good.
Sample at WOBFest 2016. Pours hazy yellow with large white head. Flavor is hops with some tropical fruit undertones, and the finish is citrus. Very nice beer.

Bottle courtesy of Minh; shared at Lillians first birthday party! Pours a beautiful, hazy bright gold with thin white lacing. Thats about where the beer peaks. Nose is chock full of tons of aggressive, abrasive spice. Mouthfeel is more of the same - pure spice dominating the palate, some grains and lemongrass, but Christ.

If I didn't know better, I'd swear that this was the original recipe for Iron Throne. Just a hint of citrus sets this off from most other comparable libations, and it is aromatic from start to finish. This is a wonderful summer beer and I'm inclined to buy a case to keep.

750mL bottle. Pours a hazy, straw yellow with a big foamy white head, very nice retention. Nose is funky barnyard, daffodils, fruit (citrus and pineapple), pepper, grass, band aids. Mouth is medium-full, creamy, medium sweetness is balanced by an underpinning bitterness throughout, spicy yeast, clove, lilies, lemongrass, bread dough, minerals, long bitter finish. Totally digging this. Only real question I have... of all the possibilities available in naming this, how is it that neither the marketing gurus at Ommegang or HBO caught the fact that this is the sixth beer in the series... but they chose (for apparently no real reason) to name it for the SEVEN Kingdoms? Otherwise... yeah, this is easily the best edition in the GOT series to date.

Bottle:
Pale gold, bubbly, with a tall white head.
Yeasty, lemony scent.
Taste is light, musty, grain malt.
Mild, grassy hops....
Pretty tasty.....soft and easy-drinking.

Draught @ Albion. Slightly hazy bright yellow with small yellowish creamy head, faint vanilla aroma, low carbonation, lightly sweet typical Belgian yeast taste with citrus peel in the background, thin body, medium bitter finish. A bit lightweight but smooth and nice.

Unclear medium yellow. Frothy, rich white head. The hops and Belgian yeast character are harmonious, complementing each other. A peppery, grassy medium dry finish. Just right amount of sweetness. Moderate bitterness. Smooth creamy medium body.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Bottle While waiting for my pepperoni pizza to cook and watch thrones. Belgium yeast, creamy citrus taste. Peppery, banana. Very light. hops underlying and balance well with yeast.

(750ml bottle) - Pours a huge foamy white head. Body is dark straw. Nice banana/clove aroma. Great flavor profile, balanced between hops and spiciness. Bit of grass to it. Somewhat effervescent mouthfeel. A winner!!
Bottle. Lemon, peach, biscuit malt, straw and alcohol aroma. Yellow with moderate head. Moderate sweet citrus, biscuit malt and moderate bitter herbal hay flavor. Nice body. Very pleasant.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2016 Draft at Bru Craft. Hazy bright yellow pour that started with a full head of white froth that left lots of messy lace. Grassy, lemony, floral hops. Toasted grains. Unripe bananas. Lemon zest. Golden plums. Celery. Parsley. Coriander. Clove. Straw. Juicy Fruit. Only barely feeling the Belgian yeast here. Unusual, but feels too jumbled.
Citrusy hops and spicy yeast dominated the nose and flavor. Nice body, dry finish. Very flavorful. Just wish these were smaller format instead of $10 singles.
A milder hoppy wheat than I was expecting. Tried on a hot day with the parents in Benson, so that was a relief. Some grassy hops, but mostly citrus, hints of resin at the end.

On tap. Poured a hazy golden color with a creamy head an some lacing. Aroma of citrus, grain, trace of yeast and spice. Taste of citrus, malt sweetness, bit of light fruit, yeast and spice. Mild bitterness and a fairly clean finish. Medium body and a smooth feel. Enjoyable beer that goes down easy.

750 corked n caged bottle,while in the middle of season 5- Pours lightly hazy straw golden with a medium bone white head and lots of carbonation bubbles. Aroma is banana, yeasty, spicy hops, lemon. The taste is similar, yeasty, banana, lemony, hop punch, medium light body, easy drinking thirst quencher, dry hoppy finish, with the lemon zest following through right after the swallow. Good beer!
Draft. Slightly hazy body, small-bubbled white head. The aroma is a bit fruity but has some depth and mellow notes like vanilla. The taste is fruity, with berries and some herbs. Perfectly balanced!

Crisp hazy golden coloured body with a nice rich off-white head, about three centimetres tall. Aroma of light grass, wheat, coriander seed, some fresh hops that show flowers and perfume. Medium-bodied; Strong grassy and herbal flavours up front with more of a saison-y kick showing some good hop flavours as well, but nothing horribly strong. Aftertaste has a lot of effervescence from the yeast with a nice banana and grassy flavour that shows through, with a rather dry finish. Overall, a nice beer that shows the dry grassy flavours nicely without having too much complexity with sugars and malt. I sampled this 75 cL caged and corked bottle purchased from Costco in Pentagon City (Arlington), Virginia on 14-April-2016 for US$7,99 sampled in the Shenandoah Mountains on 14-May-2016.
Pours a cloudy dark yellow color with a foamy head. Notes of brown sugar, yeast, yarn, and something green.

The aroma is spicy, yeasty, floral. The appearance is hazy yellow, white head. The flavor is spicy, yeasty, floral, citrus, hop forward for this style. The finish is floral, citrus, spicy. Medium in body. Nice overall.
Straw gold hazy pour, small white head. Aroma of bananas, cloves, spice and barnyard, like a saison or heff. Flavor of lemon, banana, barnyard, slightly bitter. Dry and crisp.

750 ml. Translucent, pineapple flesh-colored brew has a lasting, spongy web of foam. Aroma is peppery resin, lemon, honey with the earthy beeswax and a whiff of soap. Tastes are the same but the the pepper, zesty citrus and beeswax are more noticeable. Wheat, wood and bubblegum in the finish. Near-medium body has a big dry bias and way too much fizz.

This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a hazy burnt yellow color with a thick foamy white head. Dissipated at a nice pace, leaving a nice messy/semi-spider web lacing all around sticking nicely.
The smell started off with some banana esters, sweet grass, lemongrass, sweet wheat, subtle herbal to earthy character. Light white and black pepper slide in for the balance. Belgian yeast ever so slightly.
The taste was a dry grassy sweet to spicy flavor balancing between some herbal and earthy character. Dry banana to fruity estery aftertaste (fairly quick). Quick dry finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a crisp sweet sessionability about it. Carbonation runs good, leaning towards a lighter side but not too light. Some light crisp stickiness tries to hit my tongue, its nice and not overbearing.
Overall, a spectacular offering by Ommegang, Belgian Strong Pale ale with wheat in it, damn skippy! And Id be sure to have again.

Bottle during GoT (obviously). I have been underwhelmed by a lot of the other beers in this series, but this one is really quite good. Ommegang has made a bright, rustic, traditional Belgian wheat beer here -- its peppery, effervescent, grainy, and really tasty. The hops worked too, giving it a piney and fruity aroma that mixed well with all of the flavor from the malt and yeast. Good!
Pours hazy yellow with a fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat and citrus. Medium bodied, finishes somewhat dry and funky.
Hazy , pale golden color . Aroma of citrus, banana , flowers , Belgian yeasts and spices. Crispy, refreshing but full of flavor taste. Dry , hoppy , bitter finish.

Large Format - Cloudy, bright yellow color. Pale white head that disappeared quickly. Floral notes on the nose. Weird taste to it in fact. I get flavors of a wheat beer and a lot of flavors characteristics of a Belgium saison or double, just not as sweet.

The body was pale golden in color, very hazy, and formed a large creamy head that refused to subside. The aroma of the beer was full of banana, bubblegum, clove, and coriander. The taste had bananas up front, followed by lemon, and then the hops hit with a citrus and spice assault. The beer was hoppy, but not really bitter, allowing the sweet flavors and delicate phenols from the wheat beer side of the construction come through clearly. The body was light, and the feel creamy until the very end of each sip, when the hop acids started to linger into a long drawn out, and dry aftertaste. This is the best entry from the Game of Thrones series that Ommegang has released. Love this beer.

Pours gold into a tulip. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving spot lacing to coat surface. Banana and coriander aromas. Medium bodied with clove and banana upfront turning to bitter earth in the lasting finish.

ommegang seriously called the SIXTH beer in the series, SEVEN KINGDOMS... why? easily one of the dumber things i have seen. was it them or the show? too bad, its a rather nice wheat beer beer. creamy. but this whole series is made for yuppies.
Draft. Golden beer with a whitish head. Yeast aroma. Yeast and citrus flavor with light wheat. Medium bodied. Light wheat and light spice lingers with yeast and citrus.
Smells like a Belgian wit and the taste starts out traditional but wheat profile turns to IPA finish.
Bottle poured yellow straw with plump white head. Aroma lemon grass floral citrus blending with Belgium phenols nice clove undertones. Taste nice pine cost ris clove lemon notes finish dry!

Sample during at Daily Growler Powell during the "5th Friday $5 Fest" on 04/29/2016. Slightly cloudy yellow color with a thin white head that evaporates steadily. Stringy lacing. Coriander, wheat and citrus in the nose. Medium body with flavors of herbal wheat, spice and tropical fruit. The finish is fruity and wheaty with a mildly spicy aftertaste. Decent overall.

Bottle from Hoboken Vine while watching Season 6, Episode 3 one day late. Belgian yeast, candied sugar, earthy hops, and lemon pledge on the nose. Pours a cloudy yellow-gold color with a thick, frothy, lasting head and fairly heavy lacework. The flavor is mildly sweet up front with plenty of wheat malt and spicy yeast mid-palate and a finish that dries out quite a bit. More bitter than I expected. Finishes herbal. Interesting beer. Has some good components, but doesnt fully come together.

Pours very cloudy yellow with frothy white head. Aroma consist of strong spice Belgian yeast with sweet pillowy fluff. Flavor is sweet wheat, a hefe on steroids.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange color with big white head. Yeasty, spicy, herbal, grassy aromas and flavors.
That's what I do...I drink and I rate things. Bright gold. Bright citrus with Belgian yeast. Clean. Easy.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle corked and capped poured into a glass. Very slightly hazy golden with big fluffy head. Aroma is yeasty, light body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is yeasty, herbal hops, and dry finish. I am not a fan of most dry yeasty Belgian ales.

Pours a semi cloudy yellow color with a short lived neon white head. The aroma is of floral hops with banana notes to it. The flavor was of bitter hops with bananas. The body was medium with a bitter aftertaste. Overall it was okay.

Bottled. Pours hazy lemon, huge white head. Aroma is lemon, Belgian esters, wheat. Flavor is astringent lemon, mild wheat, slight clove, mild bubblegum, aspirin astringency. Not great for me. But its not bad.

750 ml bottle into signature tulip glass, bottled on 3/14/2016. Pours hazy/cloudy golden yellow color with a 2-3 finger dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big lemon zest, orange peel, grapefruit, peach, pear, apple, melon, berry, peppercorn, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, bread, light honey, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon zest, orange peel, grapefruit, peach, pear, apple, melon, berry, peppercorn, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, bread, light honey, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of pine/grassy bitterness and peppery yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon/orange peel, grapefruit, peach, pear, apple, melon, berry, peppercorn, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, bread, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitter/spiciness balance and no astringent flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitter/spiciness, that increases through the glass. Medium-high carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth, crisp, moderately sticky/resinous, and lightly grainy/creamy balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent Belgian IPA style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt flavors; and very smooth, crisp, and easy to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Pours hazy, straw colored with a lovely fluffy white head. Nose is lemon, pepper, coriander, banana. Taste follows through, with strong coriander note and assertive hops. A less complex, hoppier Hennepin. I like it quite a bit, though its not the best Ommegang has to offer.
Poured from a 750ml bottle. I was surprised by how overwhelming the coriander is in the aroma, soapy, herbal, light citrus. The flavor is similar with the coriander dominating.

Poured from 750ml bottle. 

Very slightly hazy, pastel yellow with a 4-finger yellow-tinged off-white head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of coriander, lemon, cloves, wheat, yeast and mild banana. 

Taste of wheat, cloves, lemon, coriander, grass, bitter citric hops and Belgian yeast. The hops come through much more strongly once the beer warms a bit. 

Medium/light body and medium/high carbonation. 

While short of being a great witbier, the hops and the ABV keep it interesting. I was put off at first, but this is growing on me--maybe because the flavor (and especially the hops) come through more strongly as the beer warns. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear yellow pour with a thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove and grassy hop. Malty flavor with banana, clove and black pepper before a piney hop finish.

Bottle. Cloudy light gold with a frothy white head. Aroma of spice, lemon, clove, basement mustiness, toasted grain, pepper. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Dry finish. Spice and bitterness are nicely balanced. Lots going on in the aroma, almost too much. Still, liked the taste and light Belgian mustiness.

Clear golden hue with a pillowy Rocky white head. Musty and earthy leafy hop nose full of grapefruity pith and a grassy earthy undertone. Crisp yet dusty body with notes of pith and melon and pale malt and a little grassy bitterness throughout.
Draft: Spicy gum drops, marshmallow peeps, lemon zest aroma. Clear amber, medium head. Lemon zest, funk, drier than the nose, a little vegetal. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

5/2/16. 750mL bottle from Five Points. I think I saw it at Warehouse as well. Mildly hazed golden pour under a nice khaki head, good lacing. Lightly funky aroma, spicy Belgian style yeast, floral, some citrus. Good flavor, dry, spicy, floral, citrus, some breadiness, champagne, lingering citrus and dryness. High carbonation. Tasty enough.
Bottle. Pours a light yellow color with a brown tint. Taste sand smells like a classic Belgian. Lots of flavor, yeast and bread like attributes. Very good

Pours lemony unclear with a a big frothy white head. Aroma brings delicous sweet biscuit and lavender so smooth in the nose. Flavors of hoppy light oine blended with a mildy sweet wheat malty profile, smooth and blended well.
Funky barnyard with orange zest aromas. Cracked wheat aromas present throughout as well. Taste is straw, doughy sweet malts, orange zest, peppery wheat, and coriander with lavender.

750 ml bottle poured into a tulip. A hazy yellow color with a massive bubbly white head. Aromas of clove and coriander, lemon, banana, and grass. Sweet fruits such as banana and melon matched with tart citrus. A crisp, dry finish with a light lingering hop bitterness. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel.

Seven Kingdoms is another Game of Thrones beer chasing Valar Morghulis for the best GoT brew that Ommegang makes. It falls short. It's smooth on the finish and pretty to look at, but overall, it's hoppiness is more off-putting than it is rewarding. The beer has good flavor to offset the unnecessary hoppiness, but it's just okay compared to Ommegang's many others.

Aroma: Belgian yeast, citrus, floral
Appearance: hazy golden with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

Bomber shared with Brian. Really tastes and smells like a Belgian beer. Did not get any hops. Not sure why it's a hoppy wheat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Large bottle consumed with commonshawn while watching Mad Max Fury Road on the brand new TV. Pours a lighter golden color with a slight haze. Head is assertive and lacing holding strong. Aroma has a definite citrus lemon presence with wheat characteristics coming through. Taste has a hoppy bitterness with the lemon citrus on the nose making another appearance as it hits the tongue. There is a certain Belgian IPA like quality in this one which is welcomed. Refreshing while still working with a slightly sticky mouthfeel. Winter is coming but at least this quality Ommegang effort will help us go out on a high note.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Big bottle with commonmac. Gold with thick long lasting white head. Smells floral and spicy. Taste is citrus, pepper, hop, alcohol nice finish. Oily but dry spicy body. Reminiscent of some high alcohol saisons. Very good. This could rule the seven kingdoms.
Pours a hazy straw color with a small white head. Smells of citrus and grain. Taste is balanced - sweet and bitter- with a notable spice profile.

Bottle from Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours hazy golden with a huge white head and a fruity aroma. There is an earthy pale malt flavor with a nice combination of fruit, yeast and hop bitterness. A hint of banana ester and an herbal finish.

Bottle. Lightly hazy bright lemon gold. Fluffy white head that leaves some residual lacing. Lemony citrus hops, hay, vanilla, slight earthy note in the aroma. Leans a bit bitter, citra like hoppiness, some grass and hay, honeydew notes too. Lighter body thats a touch slick and velvety.

750 ml bottle, bottled on 021216, best by 02/2017. Served in a Unibroue tulip, the beer pours a hazy gold color with a couple inch off-white head that stuck around for a very long time. Theres also a lot of lacing. Aroma is nice, the brew smells like wheat/grainy malt, lemon peel, bubblegum, peppery spice and Belgian yeast. I think the taste is mostly similar to the aroma, but theres also some grassiness noticeable. Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, its a bit creamy and has a good amount of carbonation. Its also smooth and easy enough to drink. I think its a good hoppy wheat ale, I enjoyed it. $8.99 a bottle.
Cool deep yellow color. White blanket head. Aroma is a little stinky, bready, and bitter. Flavor is a little bit like cleaner and finishes with belgian yeast. A mixed bag. Good bitterness and lace.
Bottle. Poured a cloudy golden body with foamy head. Aroma of grass, wheat and candied sugar. Flavor is malty with a lite hoppy backbone.
Aroma is wheat, Belgian yeast, cloves/spices and mild sweetness. The flavor is wheat, cloves/spices, Belgian yeast, citrus and a mix of bitter and dryish/yeasty finish.

Cloudy golden glow with a fluffy white head. Aroma of spice, candy, sugar, light malts, perfume and hoppyness. Taste is mild citrus hops, pronounced belgian sugar and yeast, grass, wheat, and slight malt. Easy drinking. Typical Ommegang brew. Not bad.

From a corked bottle into a Kasteel chalice. Pours cloudy yellow gold with head and lace. Aroma of yeast, grains, citrus rind and herbs. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of rich grains, yeast, straw hops, field herbs, slightly bitter roots. Overall rich, complex, challenging but tasty.

Clean pine aroma, with a touch of sweetness behind it. Pours a hazy light straw with w huge white head. Lots of hop notes including citrus, floral, and spice come through in the flavor. This is almost closer to a white IPA then a traditional Belgian or wheat ale. Very dry finish, with a nice fullness to the body. A nice beer for a warmer day.

0,75l brought from US and shared by Misa, also shared with wiosna. Thanks! Pours hazy golden with a high head. Aroma is malts, yeast and hops. Flavor is malts, belge yeast and plenty of hops. Quite enjoyable.

Bottle for premier as much as I dont like falling for marketing ploys I like both products so much I happily indulge in this ritual. Golden hazes pour bigger head. Nose is peppery and floral and plenty yeasty. Tastes of tons of Belgian yeast, banana, some fruit punch, coriander and white pepper, light malt. Fine medium bodied and palate is drying and fruity. Quite good offering for this series.

Enjoyed with the season 6 premire of Game of Thrones. Poured from Cork and Cage bomber. Pours pale golden color with a thick fluffy white head that holds form well above the rim of the glass. Aroma is floral and peppery herbal hops. Creamy mouthfeel. Flavor is citrus, fresh cut grass, peppery spiciness, and lemon. Finishes floral with herbal yeast and cloves.

It pours golden yellow with a large white head. The aroma has floral notes, coriander, lush ripe fruit, potpourri and some wheat. It has a crisp body with a lot of carbonation, but it is not very intrusive. The taste starts with grapefruit rind, rustic spices, woodiness, herbs and dry malt with a Belgian yeast going on, but not as up front as much of Ommegangs catalog - probably the hoppiness going on. The finish is quite dry with many herbal qualities. Probably my favorite of this game of thrones line.
Bottle. Aroma is belgian yeast, bubblegum, soap and light lemon. Tastes like an overly yeasty witbier. Meh. Not my kinda beer.
Poured piss yellow with a thick, white, creamy head. Aroma of spicy Belgian yeast, lemon zest, and wheat. Hoppy, bitter flavor. Soft, creamy palate. Well done!

Hazy golden yellow with a large white head. Smells citrusy, fruity, lightly sweet. Taste is bitter, juicy, bready, slightly sweet. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and active mouth-carbonation, Ommegang Game of Thrones #6 - Seven Kingdoms finishes with a subtle lingering bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Pours cloudy yellow with white fluffy head. Aroma is spicy floral, hay. The flavor is, bread, spices, citrus, suddle at the end. Sweet finish. Creamy mouth feel Excellent beer really refreshing. Overall well balanced would recommend

750ml corked bottle. Spicy Belgian yeast aroma with notes of pepper, wheat and some banana. Pours pale golden colored with a thin white head with good retention and excellent lacing. Starts with wheat malt flavors as well as light fruitiness from banana. Finishes very smooth with peppery Belgian yeast flavors that linger at the back of the palate. Nice wit beer.
Reminds of a stronger Witbier, maybe a Hoegaarden Plus. Great mouthfeel, its a good beer.
Aromas of grassy hops, floral, minty, cereal, some honey. Hazy gold with a lasting white head. Pretty dry, earthy, spearminty. Medium bodied.
Bottle. A golden color with a foamy white head. A nicely hopped Belgian ale that was enjoyable throughout. Sparkling and spicy on the palate with a nice finish and solid body.

Pours light orange with a one finger white head with pretty nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, over ripe fruits, belgian yeast, sweet malts, sourdough bread, grassy and herbal hops, and some light funk. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with a semi-creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, semi bitter, medium-long finis. Overall, a pretty tasty hoppy wheat ale that is pretty drinkable and refreshing.

Draft at Doherty's Ale House. Pours golden with an inch of white foam. Leaves a lot of lacing in the glass. Nice Belgian perfume notes on the nose. Fairly hop forward on the tongue which somehow combines nicely with the Belgian base. Finished with some nice bitterness on the tongue. Nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy pale straw color with white head. Aromas of doughy yeast, coriander, citrus, and banana. Dough and spice flavors with coriander, lemon, and grass. Light to medium body with lively carbonation.

Soft bright yellow pour with two fingers of sticky white head. Spicy/yeasty in the nose with overripe citrus and coriander. Too spicy and floral/soapy in the flavor. Yeasty notes clash with the hops to yield an overripe citrus flesh in the flavor too. Light bodied and dry.

Poured from bottle. 
Aroma of bread and spice. 
Appearance is cloudy gold with lacing. 
Tasting vanilla, bread, floral and piney hops, pepper, coriander, banana, citrus. 
Palate is creamy with hops and spice in back. 
Overall, excellent. Makes me SMH and wonder why Ive never tried the Ommegang GOT brews before.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Pours a hazy, cloudy yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma is pepper, citrus, spice, floral, and herbal notes. Flavor is pepper and spicy yeast, with herbal notes and some citrus. Has a dry, lightly bitter finish. This is quite good.

Associated Super Fresh, Brooklyn tap: pours golden with a frothy white head. Aroma is very yeasty, fruity, flowery, and quite hoppy. Reminds me of a Dupoont saison kind of. Taste is not exactly what you would expect from the aroma but it is not surprising either. Taste has a definite hoppiness. Not too bitter but not subdued like a standard Belgian ale. Nice bit of complexity but also very drinkable and easy to quaff. A hint of sweetness. Quite good.
Cloudy yellow pour, finger of fluffy white. Nose is grain and spices, kick of yeast. Leans bitter. Middle is creamy wheat, coriander, and lemon. Finish is bittersweet and delicious.
Pours golden with an active head that reduces to a soapy cap. Some yeast undertones below a thick black pepper precense. Some grassy and hay aswell. Medium body.

Draft at applebees. Pours out a hazy golden straw color with a nice fluffy white head. Aroma is of some Belgian yeast, light bubblegum, some banana, wheat, orange peel and some citrus and grassy hops. Taste is complex, soft mouthfeel with nice complexity. Notes of Belgian yeast, banana, wheat, orange, some light citrus and fruity hops with a touch of sweet grain. Solid, smooth, but complex.
bottle. golden and lightly hazy with two finger head. wheaty with some mild banana esters which add a bit of sweetness. hops bring some citrus and moderate bitterness. really well constructed.
Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Nice farmhouse citrus nose. Bitter taste, but also with a ton of citrus and a hint of barnyard. Nice!

Hazy straw colored liquid with a tallish, stable, white head. They nail my expectations for the scent of a hoppy wheat ale. Pale malt and wheat dance around with fresh hops. Hops aromas of light pine, citrus, and rosemary. Some hints of apricot and light berries. Sweet fruity start, followed by an onslaught of hops. Bitter to biting. Alcohol seems to show a bit more presence than I might have expected. Quite herbal and bitter in the finish and linger with gentian, wormwood, sage and wintergreen. Nice feel. Soft, with a light lifting carbonation. To me the flavors are more overly sharp and intense. Id be curious if a little time might mellow this one out.

Bomber into a pint glass. Pours a pale cloudy yellow. huge white head that persists. Nose is Belgian yeast and floral hops. Taste follows, with a slight citrus tinge to the wheat malt base. Finish is slightly sweet. Pretty good.

Pours a slightly hazy bright yellow golden color with fizzy white head. Wheat, citrusy pine, some light fruit, and just a hint of lemon zest on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with light hoppy pine and citrusy notes.
Tap at Republic. Hazy gold, nice white head. Spicy nose. Nice spicy bite, lingers which is nice. Well balanced, nice flavor. Very enjoyable.

750 c&c from Malt and Vine. Westmalle chalice. Pours translucent gold with a white creamy head. Aroma of yeast/spice, bready malt, citrus. Full bodied thanks to good carbonation. Flavor is yeast/spice, even a bit peppery spice, bready malt, citrus, earth, something suggesting wood/phenolics. Not sure about banana. Could be a hint here. This is fairly complex, easily identifiable as a Belgian. Sort of a pure version. Dont see many like this these days. Sometimes its good not to tear the envelope to shreds.
Bottle from whole foods.Hazy golden with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of grain and tropical fruit. Taste is fruity and grainy; barely any sweet but mildly bitter. Pretty good stuff.

Pours a hazy golden yellow from the cork and cage bomber with fluffy white head that dissipates slowly to leave good lace. Aroma of Belgian yeast and wheat up front, then resinous hops behind. Taste is more of the citrus and pine up front with an estery Belgian ending. Nice body from the carbonation and wheat, mild bitterness, this is really nice.

Tallahassee, Fl. - Market Square Liquors - 750 ml cage corked bottle. Slight haze to the medium golden pour with a silky soft white head that leaves a nice film of lacing. Aroma is pleasant, not overly apparent with some light saffron spiciness a touch of grassiness. Classic Belgian flavor with clean pear-like fruitiness, touch of yeast, some saffron spiciness. Mouthfeel has a solid spritz to it. Very satisfying.

Draft at City Beer. Hazy golden orange with a white head leaving a lasting film. Very wheaty aroma, clove, citrus, herbal, floral notes. Dry flavor, herbal and slightly hoppy. Mild bitterness on the finish. Medium light bodied, well carbonated. Good.
Hazy golden. Nose is similar to witte, ommegang yeast, lemon, herbal hops. Taste is full bodied wheat, sharp herbal hop note, a bit of lemon. It's fine not bad not great
Hazy gold. Nose rustic herbal citrus with sweet malt and Belgian yeast. Flavor is bright citrus with faint grapefruit rind, sweet wheat, and Belgian yeast.

Yeasty wheat, sour fruit, hints of some phenols and astringency in the aroma; cloudy ply golden-white color, foamy white head; hoppy (floral and herbal), lemon pithe, quite yeasty with a grassy, funky, peppery and bitter finish; light medium body, very carbonated and prickly on the palate; spicy and good

750 cc from Whole Foods PM. Pours turbid straw with frothy, white head. Nose is yeasty funk, hops, citrus. Tastes yeasty, funky, with some hops, citrus, white pepper. Smooth, but tastes homologous to most other Ommegang offerings, which isnt necessarily a bad thing, but Id love to see something new from these guys.

750ml c&c bottle from Spirits Manahawkin. Poured a hazy straw gold with a fluffy bright white head. Aroma/flavor is complex. Notes of Belgian yeast, wheat, hint of over ripe banana, grassy hops, estery and some white pepper. Bigger body with full strong carbonation. Solid beer, shitty rate.
Nice and well balanced. Potpourri and some hint of citrus peel without too much citrus. Golden pour with good head and lacing. Light sweet finish. Nice Belgian strong blonde. Tap at Gillys.

Best beer of the series so far. Aroma was decent. A little soapy with old hops and light malt. Pour was a nice hazy light gold with a one finger white head. Taste was delicious. Very hoppy and bitter with a light wheat and malt backbone. The hops were soapy and dry and lingered long after the swallow. Nice carbonation. Great beer
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
Pours straw-colored with sticky white head. Aromas of banana, clove, coriander, and hops. Taste is lemon, pepper, spice and some slight buttering hops at the end. One of the better hoppy Belgian-style brews I've tried.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a bright golden yellow with big fluffy head. Aromas of citrus peel, yeast, hay, and some grassy notes. Flavors start tart lemony, a little spicy, touch of funk...almost Duvel like...
Tap at the Gnome. Very slightly hazy golden yellow pour with a clingy white head. Wheat, banana, passion fruit, and spice. Really nice brew.
Nice, frothy, long lasting head with lots of lace. Mild, fresh hop aroma. Flavors like nose, mostly resin, some grapefruit, good balance between bitter and sweet.
Since when are comments required?????????????????????????????????????????? via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a 500ml bottle. Poured a hazy yellow orange color with a small creamy white head. Aroma was juicy tangerine, Mandarin oranges. Lots of floral hop notes, juicy citrus. Very nice, one of the best they have made so far.
Draft at Third Base. Pours fairly clear yellow with nice white head and lacing. Nose and taste is lots of Belgian spiciness followed by fruity hops. Some candy sweetness.
Draught at Beer Trappe. Golden yellow in color. Yeasty lemon goodness. Clean tasting. Nice.

Sampled from a 750 ml corked brown bottle this beer poured a murky pale yellow color with a huge foamy yellow-white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was musty with coriander, citrus and perfume. The flavor was musty, funky and dryish with yeast, coriander and perfume. long finish. Medium body. Solid. /// tried the draft as well. It was more perfumey and dry 3.2 out of 5.
From a 75 cl bottle at home. Pours a hazy gold with a fine white head. Aroma of banana. Flavors of coriander. Smooth finish.
750 ml. bottle. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of grain, malt, and fruit. Taste is wheat, yeast, malt, tropical, and some spice. Pretty good.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazed orangish yellow with almost no head but some lacing. Aroma of wheat and hop notes. Flavor is fruity, hoppy, with pineapple and tropical fruit notes. A nice hoppy wheat beer. Light bodied, above average carbonation, lingering hoppy bitter finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 A stand apart beer. The familiar Ommegang yeast twang/funk. Wheat lets the body linger and float on and on. Hops and treachery. Nose is yeast and spice.  Golden and lofty white head...nearly expected.  I should have bought two bottles.
Split with the hammer. Poured shortly hazy in the glass. Big Belgian farm funk common and always enjoyable from Ommegang. Reminded me of Witte but with a hop pop. Enjoyable.

Pours hazy solar yellow with a thick, frothy, rather persistent ivory head. Fruity aroma taps the ol Jimmy Durante from half a meter away, and then lets you have it with banana, grassy, hoppy and fresh malt notes. Flavor roars with resiny, bitter hops plus banana, pear, malty and grassy tones. Mouthfeel presents good body and subtle but lasting fizz. Wonder what sort of beer they brew in Westeros. Heeeeeeeeere dragon, dragon, dragon!

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy light to medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (herbs), lightly yeasty (basement), with strong notes of orange/lemon oil, grains of paradise, pepper, other note of gum.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic. 

This almost seems like a spiced/herbed version of Hop House...the aroma is overly intense in a herbal-spiced way, much more adjuncty than hoppy (whether or not spices/herbs were added, the effect is that there was, it does not smell natural). Not unpleasant, but too harsh to be happy about. Nicer in its other aspects, though...good flavor balance and fluffy mouthfeel with a pretty head and body. Shame the aroma isnt more enticing, this couldve been a winner.

Bottle from Table and Vine. Hazy yellow straw gold with lasting head and lace. Citrus orange wheaty tangy bubble gum and banana aroma. Tropical fruit pineapple sweetness with a hint of vanilla and wheaty tang with mild citrus and spice finish. Medium wheaty body and very soft carbo. Extremely refreshing and delicious. Excellent.

Hazy, ruby-amber colored, some floaties visible, stable off-White foamy layer; dried red berries, caramel and delicate traces of Wood and vanilla in the dark-malty nose; moderate sweet and mildly bitter flavor, medium bodied, not very soft; lingering vinous-fruity and caramelly finish with a slight bitterness in the aftertaste.

Poured from a bottle. Hazy straw. Color, medium white head. Sweet all spice aroma. Medium body with a sweet all spice flavor and a nice finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of citrus hops and spice a bit like a session pale meets a Belgian. Cloudy pale gold color, with a lasting white head. Taste like a typical Belgian, cloves, spice and a hint of banana. Medium body with a nice hop finish.
